channel.title: Quick N Easy Question
channel.description:
Will pay Rsgp to the person who tells me info/shows
Hello, I am just playing around with this Hybrid-PvP Client+Source.
So, I don't want to make is online or anything, I just want to be able to log in. So I just want to know what I need to change to be able to "Compile" it.
So here is what my Run Server.bat looks like:
@echo off title Project Insanity java -Xmx800m -cp bin;deps/poi.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/jython.jar;log4j-1.2.15.jar; server.Server pause
This is what my Compile looks like:
@echo off "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_24\bin\javac.exe" -classpath deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/jython.jar;deps/xstream.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/poi.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar -d bin src\server\event\*.java src\server\model\items\*.java src\server\model\minigames\*.java src\server\model\npcs\*.java src\server\model\objects\*.java src\server\model\players\*.java src\server\model\players\skills\*.java src\server\model\players\packets\*.java src\server\model\shops\*.java src\server\net\*.java src\server\task\*.java src\server\util\*.java src\server\world\*.java src\server\util\log\*.java src\server\*.java src\server\world\map\*.java pause

item.title: Quick N Easy Question
item.dc:creator: @Ain Ain
item.description:
@Ain wrote:

When I click run in the client it says like “exception in thread “main” java…”

When I compile in from the source it still does not work… My compile looks like this:

@echo off
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_27\bin\javac.exe” -classpath deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/jython.jar;deps/xstream.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/poi.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar -d bin src\server\event*.java src\server\model\items*.java src\server\model\minigames*.java src\server\model\npcs*.java src\server\model\objects*.java src\server\model\players*.java src\server\model\players\skills*.java src\server\model\players\packets*.java src\server\model\shops*.java src\server\net*.java src\server\task*.java src\server\util*.java src\server\world*.java src\server\util\log*.java src\server*.java src\server\world\map*.java
pause

My JDK is 27, do I need to delete all that stuff in the middle? or what?

Read full topic

item.title: Quick N Easy Question
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

Ain:

Ok… so I’m not downloading anything… guys. All I need is someone to tell me what to put into it… O.o

If you’re on windows… Go to C:/Program Files/Java/ and see what jdk version you have. Use that name.

Read full topic

item.title: Quick N Easy Question
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

  1. You should add the JDK to your PATH variable (look in the Tutorial Section)
  2. You should probably look into using Apache Ant; it simplifies the build process exponentially. Here’s my default script
<project name="RSPS" default="build">
    <property name="src.dir" value="src" />
    <property name="build.dir" value="build" />
    <target name="clean">
        <delete dir="${build.dir}" />
        <mkdir dir="${build.dir}" />
    </target>
    <target name="build" depends="clean">
        <javac srcdir="${src.dir}" destdir="${build.dir}" listfiles="false"
            includeantruntime="false" />
    </target>
</project>

It will remove all of your old files (which many server’s surprisingly don’t do), and attempt to compile the java files in the “${src.dir}” directory. It will do it recursively, so you don’t have to add all of the source directories manually.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Ain wrote:

27 perhaps? I am updating it… so would it be

@echo off
